Here are the latest AI news headlines:

## **1. OpenAI Brings Sora Video-Generating App to Android Devices**
- **Source:** Bloomberg
- **Published:** November 4, 2025
- **Summary:** OpenAI has released its Sora social video app on Android devices, one month after launching the popular and controversial AI-powered video-generating service on iPhone.
- [Read more](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-11-04/openai-brings-sora-video-generating-app-to-android-devices)

## **2. Amazon Demands Perplexity Stop AI Agent From Making Purchases**
- **Source:** Bloomberg  
- **Published:** November 4, 2025
- **Summary:** Amazon has sent a cease-and-desist letter to Perplexity AI, demanding the startup stop allowing its AI browser agent, Comet, to make online purchases for users.
- [Read more](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-11-04/amazon-demands-perplexity-stop-ai-agent-from-making-purchases)

## **3. Artificial Intelligence Training is Powered Mostly by Fossil Fuels**
- **Source:** New Scientist
- **Published:** February 28, 2023
- **Summary:** An analysis of 95 AIs reveals that most AI training relies on electrical grids primarily powered by coal and gas rather than low-carbon sources, highlighting environmental concerns.
- [Read more](https://www.newscientist.com/article/2361343-artificial-intelligence-training-is-powered-mostly-by-fossil-fuels/)

The top stories today focus on OpenAI's expansion of its Sora app to Android and Amazon's legal action against Perplexity AI's shopping agent feature.
